page.title: 09LEATON KNOLLS CONT'D.
page.content: {LEATON KNOLLS} _ NATURAL HISTORY & ECOLOGY The land cover of this area is mainly arable or pasture fields.There are also some large bands of mixed woodland crossing the B5067.The trees are mainly oak,sycamore & horse chestnut,which are deciduous,and pine,spruce & larch,which are coniferous. Although some of the fields are bordered with modern metal fences,in some places,the traditional hedges remain.These consist mainly of holly,hazel & hawthorne.There are dog roses growing profusely in the hedgerows,and many nettles and thistles.Different species of cow parsley & dock are common in the verges & in the edges of the fields in this totally unspoilt area of Shropshire.(cont. on page 10)
